title: Thiefbane
data:
| )   Thiefbane   *(No tile)*           |                                                      |
| ------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------- |
| Base item                             | [long sword](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword")          |
|                                       |                                                      |
| Damage vs. small                      | 1d8 **+1 + level drain + cancellation + beheading**  |
| Damage vs. large                      | 1d12 **+1 + level drain + cancellation + beheading** |
| To-hit bonus                          | **+5**                                               |
| Bonus versus                          | [@](/wiki/@ "@")                                     |
|                                       |                                                      |
| Weapon skill                          | [long sword](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword")          |
| Size                                  | one-handed                                           |
| Affiliation                           | [chaotic](/wiki/Chaotic "Chaotic")                   |
|                                       |                                                      |
| When carried                          | *(none)*                                             |
| When wielded                          | *(none)*                                             |
| When [invoked](/wiki/Invoke "Invoke") | *(none)*                                             |
|                                       |                                                      |
| Base price                            | 1500 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")                   |
| Weight                                | [40](/wiki/Weight "Weight")                          |
| Material                              | [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron")                            |

**Thiefbane** is an artifact weapon in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"), and [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"). Generally a [chaotic](/wiki/Chaotic "Chaotic") [long sword](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword"), it is found in the possession of [One-eyed Sam](/wiki/One-eyed_Sam "One-eyed Sam") in the [Black Market](/wiki/Black_Market "Black Market").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Description](#Description)
- [2 Generation](#Generation)
- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [4 References](#References)

## Description

Against monsters represented by @, Thiefbane has a 10% chance of [beheading](/wiki/Beheading "Beheading"), causes [level drain](/wiki/Level_drain "Level drain") similar to [Stormbringer](/wiki/Stormbringer "Stormbringer"), and has +5 to hit and +1 damage. Thiefbane also has a 1 in 6 chance of [canceling](/wiki/Canceling "Canceling") any @ it hits.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) This also means that Thiefbane will subject you to [artifact blasts](/wiki/Artifact_blast "Artifact blast") even if you are chaotic, since you are always represented by @.

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), Thiefbane's base item class has been changed to [two-handed sword](/wiki/Two-handed_sword "Two-handed sword") and the player is in danger of being decapitated even if not in a form symbolized by @.

## Generation

Thiefbane will always be generated in One-Eyed Sam's inventory. It cannot be randomly generated or wished for[\[2\]](#cite_note-2), or even found in [bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones")[\[3\]](#cite_note-3).

Thiefbane will be well-enchanted, but it is not generated [rustproof](/wiki/Rustproof "Rustproof"), as players who elect to kill Sam via controlled [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") into a [giant shoggoth](/wiki/Giant_shoggoth "Giant shoggoth") will discover.

## Strategy

Thiefbane is the primary reason that angering One-eyed Sam is frequently a game-ending mistake; against the player, it is easily the deadliest weapon in the game. However, in the player's hands, it is somewhat underwhelming, as for the most part non-player @ are not particularly dangerous or common. One possible exception is on the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane"), with its hordes of [aligned priests](/wiki/Aligned_priest "Aligned priest") and [player monsters](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster"), but even there, most players will likely prefer a weapon such as [Vorpal Blade](/wiki/Vorpal_Blade "Vorpal Blade") or [Excalibur](/wiki/Excalibur "Excalibur").

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/artifact.c in UnNetHack revision 1406, line 1206](http://sourceforge.net/p/unnethack/code/1406/tree/trunk/src/artifact.c#l1206)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [objnam.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 3018](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/objnam.c#line3018 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/objnam.c")
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [bones.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 124](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/bones.c#line124 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/bones.c")

html:
Thiefbane

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
)   Thiefbane   (No tile)
Base item long sword
Damage vs. small 1d8 +1 + level drain + cancellation + beheading
Damage vs. large 1d12 +1 + level drain + cancellation + beheading
To-hit bonus +5
Bonus versus @
Weapon skill long sword
Size one-handed
Affiliation

chaotic

When carried

(none)

When wielded

(none)

When invoked

(none)

Base price 1500 zm
Weight 40
Material iron

Thiefbane is an artifact weapon in SLASH'EM, SlashTHEM, SpliceHack, Hack'EM, and UnNetHack. Generally a chaotic long sword, it is found in the possession of One-eyed Sam in the Black Market.

Contents

  • 1 Description
  • 2 Generation
  • 3 Strategy
  • 4 References

Description

Against monsters represented by @, Thiefbane has a 10% chance of beheading, causes level drain similar to Stormbringer, and has +5 to hit and +1 damage. Thiefbane also has a 1 in 6 chance of canceling any @ it hits.[1] This also means that Thiefbane will subject you to artifact blasts even if you are chaotic, since you are always represented by @.

In UnNetHack, Thiefbane's base item class has been changed to two-handed sword and the player is in danger of being decapitated even if not in a form symbolized by @.

Generation

Thiefbane will always be generated in One-Eyed Sam's inventory. It cannot be randomly generated or wished for[2], or even found in bones[3].

Thiefbane will be well-enchanted, but it is not generated rustproof, as players who elect to kill Sam via controlled polymorph into a giant shoggoth will discover.

Strategy

Thiefbane is the primary reason that angering One-eyed Sam is frequently a game-ending mistake; against the player, it is easily the deadliest weapon in the game. However, in the player's hands, it is somewhat underwhelming, as for the most part non-player @ are not particularly dangerous or common. One possible exception is on the Astral Plane, with its hordes of aligned priests and player monsters, but even there, most players will likely prefer a weapon such as Vorpal Blade or Excalibur.

References

  1. ↑ src/artifact.c in UnNetHack revision 1406, line 1206
  2. ↑ objnam.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 3018
  3. ↑ bones.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 124

"Update to reflect THEM/Hack'EM"

'''Thiefbane''' is an artifact weapon in [[SLASH'EM]], [[SlashTHEM]], [[SpliceHack]], [[Hack'EM]], and [[UnNetHack]]. Generally a [[chaotic]] [[long sword]], it is found in the possession of [[One-eyed Sam]] in the [[Black Market]].

==Description==
Against monsters represented by {{white|@}}, Thiefbane has a 10% chance of [[beheading]], causes [[level drain]] similar to [[Stormbringer]], and has +5 to hit and +1 damage. Thiefbane also has a 1 in 6 chance of [[canceling]] any {{white|@}} it hits.{{refsrc|src/artifact.c|1206|unnethack=1406}} This also means that Thiefbane will subject you to [[artifact blast]]s even if you are chaotic, since you are always represented by {{white|@}}.

In [[UnNetHack]], Thiefbane's base item class has been changed to [[two-handed sword]] and the player is in danger of being decapitated even if not in a form symbolized by {{white|@}}.

==Generation==
Thiefbane will always be generated in One-Eyed Sam's inventory. It cannot be randomly generated or wished for{{refsrc|objnam.c|3018|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}, or even found in [[bones]]{{refsrc|bones.c|124|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}.

Thiefbane will be well-enchanted, but it is not generated [[rustproof]], as players who elect to kill Sam via controlled [[polymorph]] into a [[giant shoggoth]] will discover.

==Strategy==
Thiefbane is the primary reason that angering One-eyed Sam is frequently a game-ending mistake; against the player, it is easily the deadliest weapon in the game.  However, in the player's hands, it is somewhat underwhelming, as for the most part non-player {{white|@}} are not particularly dangerous or common.  One possible exception is on the [[Astral Plane]], with its hordes of [[aligned priest]]s and [[player monster]]s, but even there, most players will likely prefer a weapon such as [[Vorpal Blade]] or [[Excalibur]].
